body:
#### Feature Description

MYSQL_FLAVOR autodetection can fail because no mysqld is present locally, or VT_MYSQL_ROOT has been set to a strange location.

We should change the panic error message to include both of these environment variables so that bug reports can be better understood.

This will be more useful than the current output:

```
panic: could not detect version from mysqld --version or MYSQL_FLAVOR [recovered]panic: 
	could not detect version from mysqld --version or MYSQL_FLAVORpanic: could not detect version from mysqld --version or MYSQL_FLAVOR [recovered]
```

title: Improve error message on MySQL Flavor autodetect failing
